Type.Name: Toolbar

TypeSignature.Value: public class Toolbar : Gtk.Container, Implementor, IWrapper, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Create bars of buttons and other widgets.

remarks.para: A is created with a call to .
Buttons with text and/or images are added with , , and .
Any of , , or an arbitrary widget can be added to the toolbar with , , and .
Widgets can be visibly grouped by adding gaps between widgets using , , and .

Docs.summary: Inserts a new item into the toolbar. You must specify the position in the toolbar where it will be inserted.
Docs.param: Text for the button label.
A string that appears when the user holds the mouse over this item.
Text used for context-sensitive help about this toolbar element.
A that should be used as the icon for the button.
The function to be executed when the button is pressed.
an object of type
The number of widgets to insert this item after.
Docs.returns: The new toolbar element as a .

Docs.summary: Adds a new space to the beginning of the toolbar.
Unsets a toolbar style set with .
Docs.remarks: Unsets a toolbar style set with , so that user preferences will be used to determine the toolbar style.

MemberSignature.Value: public Gtk.Widget InsertStock (string stock_id, string tooltip_text, string tooltip_private_text, Gtk.SignalFunc callback, IntPtr user_data, int position);

Docs.summary: Inserts a stock item at the specified position of the toolbar.
Docs.param: The id of the stock item you want to insert
The text in the tooltip of the toolbar button
The private text of the tooltip
The callback called when the toolbar button is clicked.
an object of type
The position the button shall be inserted at. -1 means at the end.
Docs.remarks: If is not a known stock item ID, it is inserted verbatim, except that underscores used to mark mnemonics are removed.

Docs.summary: Disposes the resources associated with the object.
Internal constructor
Docs.param: Pointer to the C object.
Docs.returns: An instance of Toolbar, wrapping the C object.

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Creates a new toolbar.
The for

This function sets the size of stock icons in the toolbar. You can call it both before you add the icons and after they have been added. The size you set will override user preferences for the default icon size.
Docs.param: The that stock icons in the toolbar shall have.
Docs.returns: The icon size for the toolbar.

Docs.summary: Sets if the tooltips of a toolbar should be active or not.
Docs.param: set to to disable the tooltips, or to enable them.

Docs.summary: Alters the view of toolbar to display either icons only, text only, or both.
Docs.param: The new style for toolbar.

Docs.summary: Sets the of the toolbar to either or .
Docs.param: The orientation of the toolbar.

Docs.summary: Used if you wish to perform an action when the orientation of a toolbar is changed.
Used if you wish to perform an action when ever the style of a toolbar is adjusted.
Docs.remarks: For example, this would be a useful signal to connect to if you want to display more items on the toolbar when it is in icon-only mode; each item takes less space on the bar.

Docs.summary: Internal constructor
Docs.param: GLib type for the type
Docs.returns: Creates a new instance of Toolbar, using the GLib-provided type

remarks.para: This is a constructor used by derivative types of that would have their own GLib type assigned to it. This is not typically used by C# code.
